page.title: 04HOUSING
page.content: FRONTING THE ROAD WHICH RUNS DIAGONALLY THROUGH THE AREA FROM NEW RADNOR TO KINNERTON AND IN LANES LEADING OFF ARE SOME 30 DWELLINGS OF WHICH 23 ARE PERMANENTLY OCCUPIED. SIX ARE FARM HOUSES, FOUR HOLIDAY COTTAGES AND TWO ARE UNOCCUPIED. ANOTHER IS A MOBILE HOME/SCHOOL USED AS A FIELD STUDY CENTRE. IT IS CURRENTLY FOR SALE BUT THERE IS LITTLE DEMAND FOR SUCH A PLACE AS THE COUNCIL IS RELUCTANT TO ALLOW CHANGE OF USE TO RESIDENTIAL STATUS. MOST HOUSES ARE MODERNISED OLD FARM HOUSES OR COTTAGES. ONE IS AN ORIGINAL UNMODERNISED WELSH LONGHOUSE, THE ANIMAL ACCOMMODATION AND LIVING QUARTERS BEING CONTAINED UNDER ONE ROOF. THERE ARE ALSO SEVEN NEW HOUSES OR BUNGALOWS DOTTED ABOUT THE AREA. ALL HOUSES HAVE RUNNING WATER, ELECTRICITY AND SOME MAIN DRAINAGE.
